file_content.text: I'm surprised you survived. So, is it done? Is Grathan's son dead?
It was easy.
Somehow I doubt that.
He put up a good fight.
The kid was tough.
So you had trouble, huh? Maybe Lord Baras's opinion of you is overblown.
You're a condescending windbag, Ba'al.
I don't like your attitude.
It's pretty easy to push your buttons, brute.
Doesn't say much for Grathan's security forces if a clumsy clod like you was able to bang into his private chamber and off his son.
We're done here. Goodbye, Ba'al.
I'm ignoring you.
I'm afraid you won't be leaving here, brute.
I find your empty chatter amusing.
You're laughable.
You'll find my lightsaber a bit sobering.
Why don't you back up that mouth with action?
Are you all talk?
That's exactly what I had in mind.
Killing the murderer of Grathan's son will solidify my cover here. Baras can replace you easily.
You're making a big mistake.
Don't do this.
Aren't you the scoundrel?
What a surprise.
You don't know the half of it.
Baras will be needing a new spy. I'm going to enjoy killing you.
Time for you to die, then.
Though I'm more than capable of facing you alone, a smart man uses every advantage--and I am a smart man.
The intruder! The intruder is here! Everyone, to me! Attack!
Thanks to your obvious intrusion, the whole place is stirred up. I'd hurry to Grathan's private quarters and off his son quick if I were you.
You must be the operative Lord Baras sent. I thought he'd choose a stealthy assassin, not some senseless savage.
Watch who you're calling a savage.
Mind yourself.
You're not talking to one of Baras's Imperial peons. I'll be working for Lord Baras long after you've worn out your welcome.
I highly doubt that.
Seems unlikely.
Care to put that theory to the test?
I could prove you wrong.
Just tell me the situation here.
I have a job to do.
Fine. I'll rise above my discontent--for now.
Baras knows what he's doing.
Don't question our master.
I suppose he wants a spectacle, or he wouldn't have entrusted such a blunt and tactless animal.
I don't have time for this nonsense.
Get over it.
You're right. We can pick up hating each other once the business here is complete.
There's more to me than meets the eye.
You think you know me?
Do you want to die?
Not fond of living?
We've got business to handle. With the entire complex roused, we'll have to get in each other's faces another time.
Now listen--Lord Grathan is a rogue Sith who boldly defies the Dark Council. Locked away here, he's been untouchable.
No one is untouchable.
That ends today.
Grathan is about to learn that.
He might as well be in league with the Republic.
So, he's a traitor.
Yes. And he's performing his traitorous acts on the Empire's front lawn.
No doubt he's driving the other Sith Lords mad.
The council must be incensed.
He's more than a nuisance. His defiance is a serious threat to the Empire.
Lord Baras wants to let Grathan know he can be reached. And after a year undercover, I've discovered the way--Lord Grathan has a son!
What does that have to do with anything?
So?
I'm fascinated to hear where this is going.
Interesting.
Maybe in another year you can find out his shoe size.
A year and that's all you got?
He wears boots not shoes, smart mouth.
I was assigned to find Grathan's weakness. He's kept his son a secret in order to protect him from his enemies.
Grathan would be devastated if his only child and heir was dead. That would send a message.
Just tell me where he is. I will be the messenger.
Fine by me.
You'll have to be more than a messenger.
I'm no baby killer.
I don't fight the defenseless.
We're not talking about a baby, here.
Won't killing his son just make Grathan mad?
That could make matters worse.
Lord Baras seeks to imbalance Grathan, make him sloppy.
Grathan's kid is nearly twenty, and strong with the Force. He's been trained in the ways of the Sith since birth. You'll have your hands full.
Good.
I highly doubt it.
That's unlikely.
All right, maybe underestimating your foes works for you.
I'll fill my hands with his entrails.
He's going to suffer.
My, how graphic. You're a true vulgarian.
Grathan's away on business. I managed to hack a special spike that will get you inside his private quarters.
But first, you're going to have to knock out Grathan's surveillance stations so you aren't seen entering the quarters.
Tell me what that entails.
Instruct me.
A trivial matter.
Yes, we wouldn't want to tax you with anything too complicated.
What do I care if I'm observed?
Are we trying to be secretive?
The surveillance system is also a sophisticated defense network.
If you don't destroy the system before entering the private chambers, you'll never make it.
All you have to do is locate the monitoring stations around the compound and well, stick your lightsaber in them. Think you can handle that, brute?
Is that all I need to know?
Anything else?
Fine.
Keep calling me names, Ba'al. You're playing with fire.
You're annoying me.
Is it so easy to get under your skin?
That's all, then. Destroy the monitoring stations then use the passcard to get inside Grathan's private quarters.
The son's name is Beelzlit. Find him and end him. I'll meet you back here when you're done. Try not to screw it up.
I kind of like his attitude.
When I get back, I'm going to adjust your attitude.
I'll deal with him, then you.
You can certainly try.
Don't wander off.
With a name like that, the kid deserves to die.
He named him "Beelzlit? "
We all deserve to die, cretin.
Here's the hacked security spike to Grathan's private quarters. Now go.
I'm... dead.
